conbody.p: The 5G architecture is defined as service-based and the interaction between network functions is represented using service-based interfaces for their interactions. The service-based architecture uses network functions (for example, Session Management Function (SMF)) within the control plane to enable other authorized network functions to access their services. A subset of the 5G service-based architecture with the supported protocol interfaces is shown in the following figure.

fig.title: 5G architecture and interfaces in NCC CNF

conbody.p: The initial NCC CNF version supports the Charging Function (CHF). NCC CNF supports interfaces such as N28 interface between CHF and PCF as defined in 3GPP standard 29.594. NCC provides charging support for Nchf_SpendingLimitControl (N28). The Nchf_SpendingLimitControl service enables transfer of policy counter status information relating to subscriber spending limits from the CHF to the NF consumer.
NCC CNF also supports the N40 interface between SMF and CHF as defined in TS 32.240 to enable online and offline charging.

Incoming 5G messages arrive on HTTP/2 and come through the HTTP ingress gateway. They are then load balanced to the charging pods. Responses are delivered back through the HTTP infrastructure to the originating source.

If the subscriber / device for a received 5G message is not homed on the receiving NCC ME, the charging pod on that ME will leverage its site routing function to determine the currently active home ME. The message is converted into a Diameter message as per a configured conversion dictionary and routed to the destination home ME, where it gets appropriately processed per 5G requirements. Responses back to the originating source will be over HTTP/2, just as the initial message.

NCC CNF supports metrics for 5G message handling that enable separate analysis from the 4G Diameter message handling. For more information about 5G metrics and alarms, see the respective chapters for measurements and alarms in CNF Operation, Administration, and Maintenance Guide in the NCC documentation set.
